item.title: 9 Most Expensive Video Game Collector’s Editions, Ranked
item.description:
Publishers have long used collector's editions to not just celebrate the launch of their flagship titles, but also to offer their most loyal fans a deeper connection to the games they love. These limited editions bundle exclusive memorabilia, figurines, signed artwork, and other premium collectibles that bring the games to life beyond the screen.

All that, however, gets slapped with a hefty price tag. While some fans see it as a small price to pay for something special to display on their shelves or showcases, in certain cases, publishers have pushed the boundaries with exorbitantly expensive editions.

Ranging from thousands to even millions of dollars, these high-end offerings cater to those who crave exclusivity and are willing to spend big. For them, these editions provide a rare opportunity to own a piece of gaming history.

In this list, we’re ranking the most over-the-top, high-priced collector’s editions ever made in gaming history, each one a testament to just how far some publishers are willing to go.

Some of these video game editions were originally priced in other currencies. They have been converted to USD using the May 2025 exchange rates.

9 Armored Core 6 - Premium Edition ($450)

Bundled a Giant Mech Diorama

Armored Core 6 earns its place on this list not just for its hefty price tag, but for bundling in a collector’s dream that makes it feel worth every penny.

Fans had to shell out $450 for a premium 19cm Armored Core statue that came with a 32cm garage display unit , transforming the iconic mech from a simple collectible into a full-blown diorama. Here's what else it included:

  • Premium steelbook case with silver background and etched mech outline.
  • Digital soundtrack.
  • 40-page artbook.
  • Set of 4-pin badges in a special case.
  • 45 sticker sheets (featuring in-game emblems for mech customization).

Your comment has not been saved

Armored Core 6: Fires of Rubicon
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
August 25, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
9.0 /10

Powered by

8 Project Cars 2 - Ultra Edition ($550)

Bundled a McLaren 720S Model

Project Cars 2 was released in 2017 with two editions that both featured a scale model of the McLaren 720S . However, it was the high-end Ultra Edition that featured a larger model alongside a premium collector's box and additional goodies. Limited to 1,000 copies, players can still find this collectible for sale on eBay for up to $800 .

It included the following:

  • Steelbook case and physical copy of the game.
  • Japanese Cars Pack download code.
  • Season pass download code.
  • Sticker sheet.
  • Collector’s Edition box.
  • E-Sports Live VIP Pass.
  • 200-page art book.
  • McLaren 720S sketchbook.
  • Individually numbered cap.
  • Poster signed by the SMS team and SMS-R drivers.

Your comment has not been saved

Project CARS 2
9.0 /10
Released
September 21, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Powered by

7 Resident Evil 6 - Premium Edition (~$730)

Bundled a Real-Life Leather Jacket

As one of the most recognizable faces of the long-running Resident Evil franchise, Leon Kennedy is known for working solo. However, that doesn’t mean players can’t step into his shoes... or slip on his jacket, for that matter.

Resident Evil 6 's collector's edition, priced at around $730, came with a replica of Leon's signature leather jacket . Claimed to be made of genuine leather, it actually looked pretty high-quality. Capcom also threw in a copy of the game with four different covers, one each for Leon Kennedy, Chris Redfield, Jake Muller, and Ada Wong.

Unfortunately, the Premium Edition's 2012 release was exclusive to Japan, making it impossible for Western fans to part with their savings.

Your comment has not been saved

Resident Evil 6
6 /10
6.3 /10
Released
October 2, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
6 /10
6.3 /10

Powered by

6 Assassin’s Creed: Origins – Dawn of the Creed Legendary Edition ($800)

Bundled a Giant Statue of Bayek and Senu

Assassin’s Creed Origins was released in 2017 with seven different versions, the highest-end of which was an $800-priced Dawn of the Creed Legendary Edition. Its main highlight was a 29-inch resin figurine of the protagonist Bayek and his eagle Senu . That and a replica of Bayek's eagle skull amulet.

It also included the following:

  • A hand-drawn world map of Assassin’s Creed Origins’ Egypt.
  • x4 15-inch by 11-inch lithographs signed by Ubisoft.
  • x2 Steelbook cases.
  • Numbered certificate of authenticity.
  • Artbook and art cards.
  • Official game soundtrack.
  • x1 copy of the game, including the season pass, and other digital goods.

This ultra-expensive video game collector’s edition was limited to 1,000 copies, though Ubisoft never revealed how many were actually sold.

Your comment has not been saved

Assassin's Creed Origins
8.6 /10
Released
October 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

5 Dark Souls 3 - Prestige Edition ($800)

Bundled a Massive Lord of the Cinder Figure

The jaw-dropping Prestige Edition of Dark Souls 3 quickly earned its place as one of the most expensive and coveted collector’s editions in gaming history, thanks to two driving factors.

Firstly, the dedicated Dark Souls fan base is famously known for embracing every fragment of lore and collectible. Secondly, the edition’s centerpiece was simply too stunning to ignore: a towering 40cm Lord of Cinder figure , sculpted in exquisite detail to embody the decayed grandeur of the main bosses.

There was also a 25cm Red Knight figurine that could form a pair with the Lord of Cinder, making it a fine showcase for any shelf.

Here's what else the Prestige Edition featured:

  • Hardcover artbook filled with concept art and illustrations.
  • Cloth game map of Lothric and the surrounding lands.
  • Collector’s edition box featuring exclusive artwork.
  • Steelbook case.
  • Official soundtrack CD.
  • Set of three iron-on patches.
  • A3-size art prints.
  • Physical copy of Dark Souls 3 .

Only 2,000 units were ever made, and they sold out almost immediately. It also didn't take long for the figurines to surface on eBay for exorbitant prices.

Your comment has not been saved

Dark Souls 3
8 /10
18
9.3 /10
Released
March 24, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
18
9.3 /10

Powered by

4 GRID 2 - Mono Edition (~$166,000)

Bundled a Real-Life Supercar

Everyone dreams about owning their own race car. Codemasters took this a bit too seriously by announcing the Mono Edition for GRID 2 in 2013.

Paying about $166,000 guaranteed one player to essentially buy a 170-mph BAC Mono supercar and get the game for free. The car came with exclusive GRID 2 branding and was completely street legal. It also included the following:

  • A custom Bell Racing helmet.
  • A custom set of race suit, boots, and gloves.
  • A day at the BAC factory, including a factory tour and time spent with technicians to customize the BAC Mono for size and specifications.

Unlike Dying Light's Apocalypse Edition, someone actually bought the Mono Edition.

Your comment has not been saved

GRID 2
8.0 /10
Released
May 28, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

3 Dying Light - My Apocalypse Edition (~$332,000)

Bundled a Real-Life Zombie-Proof Cabin With Adult Diapers, Just in Case

Someone in Techland’s marketing team apparently thought that because Dying Light is about outrunning zombies, one lucky (and loaded) fan would leap at the chance to do real-world parkour and live in a custom-built, zombie-proof cabin .

Dying Light ’s My Apocalypse Edition was announced in 2015 as a six-figure prep kit for the end of days. Coming in at an eye-watering $332,000, it promised the ultimate immersive survival experience. This one-of-a-kind edition included:

  • A custom-built zombie-proof shelter by Tiger Log Cabins.
  • Real-life parkour lessons with Ampisound.
  • A round-trip flight to visit Techland in Wroclaw, Poland.
  • Your face in the game.
  • A life-sized Volatile statue.
  • x4 signed Steelbook editions of Dying Light .
  • x2 Razer Tiamat headphones.
  • Custom night vision goggles and adult diapers.

However, not one of Dying Light's millions of fans took the bait, and no one purchased the most expensive collector's edition ever offered.

10 Images
10 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Dying Light
7 /10
11
9.2 /10
Released
January 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
7 /10
11
9.2 /10

Powered by

2 Saints Row 4 - The Super Dangerous Wad Wad Edition ($1 Million)

Bundled a Space Flight, a Lamborghini Gallardo, and Peak Absurdity

Known for embracing absurdity and over-the-top gameplay, it's only fitting that Saints Row 4 had one of the most ridiculously priced collector’s editions ever. The Super Dangerous Wad Wad Edition was priced at $1 million, and for obvious reasons, only one was ever made.

The Wad Wad Edition was meant to significantly change its owner's life. It included a Lamborghini Gallardo, a Toyota Prius, and luxury stays at the Jefferson Hotel in D.C. and the Burj Al-Arab in Dubai, complete with first-class flights.

That was just the start. The owner would also get to enjoy a space flight, spy training, a hostage rescue mission, and not to forget, plastic surgery .

Here's its long list of offerings:

  • 1x Saints Row IV: Commander in Chief Edition.
  • 1x Full-size Replica Dubstep Gun.
  • 1x Virgin Galactic Space Flight.
  • 1x Hostage Rescue Experience.
  • 1x Spy Training Day.
  • Plastic Surgery.
  • A Personal Shopper.
  • A Capsule Wardrobe.
  • 7 Nights in the Top Royal Suite at the Burj Al Arab, Dubai.
  • A Week-Long Stay for Two at the Jefferson Hotel, Washington, D.C..
  • First-class flights for both the Dubai and D.C. trips.
  • 1x Lamborghini Gallardo.
  • 1x Toyota Prius with 1 Year of Insurance.
  • 1x Year’s Supercar Club Membership.

Let this serve as a peak reminder of the franchise’s height of zaniness, constantly outdoing itself with ever more bizarre experiences, something the recent Saints Row reboot failed to capture.

Your comment has not been saved

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
7.4 /10

Powered by

1 Dying Light: The Following - Spotlight Edition ($10 Million)

Bundled a Supporting Role in a Movie Adaptation

Techland’s marketing team has a knack for dreaming up ludicrous special editions as part of their publicity stunts. For Dying Light: The Following , the standalone expansion, they announced a Spotlight Edition in 2016 that offered one fan the once-in-a-lifetime chance to star in their very own Dying Light movie .

For $10 million, a Dying Light fan would get a supporting role in the movie along with the following:

  • Professional acting lessons from Roger Craig Smith.
  • A luxury trailer to stay in during the filming of the movie.
  • Stuntman and parkour training sessions.
  • Off-road driving lessons, where they get to keep the car.
  • x10 VIP tickets to the movie premiere.
  • x4 copies of the game, each signed by Techland.
  • The chance to voice a future character in the game.

While the dream of a live-action adaptation only lived for a brief moment, Dying Light's Spotlight Edition still managed to earn a place in the Guinness World Records as the most valuable video game package ever offered.

Dying Light: The Following

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10

item.title: Genshin Impact: Mistakes Players Make When Using Escoffier
item.description:
Escoffier

Cryo

Polearm

Fontaine

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Escoffier is a Cryo support designed to enhance team performance through off-field sub-DPS, resistance shredding, and healing in Genshin Impact . She works best in niche Freeze-oriented setups, where her abilities complement her teammates and allow for optimized damage output. While her role is primarily utility-based, she has mechanics that allow her to contribute more actively in battle.

While Escoffier's kit is quite straightforward, to fully maximize Escoffier’s utility in the team, players should pay good attention to its details. By understanding her mechanics and how they interact with different team compositions, players can refine their strategies and get the most out of her skillset.Here are some common mistakes players might make when using Escoffier in Genshin Impact .

4 Not Paying Attention to Team Synergies

Escoffier’s effectiveness depends entirely on Cryo-Hydro synergy, making her a niche support that thrives in Freeze-based teams. Her Hydro and Cryo resistance shred directly scales with the number of Cryo and Hydro units in a party, meaning mixed-element compositions will weaken her buffing potential.

Beyond elemental composition, some characters have exceptional synergy with Escoffier due to their unique mechanics. For instance, Furina offers different types of buffs , including damage scaling through HP drain, which works perfectly alongside Escoffier’s healing. This interaction ensures that Furina can maintain maximum buff uptime while Escoffier stabilizes the team’s sustainability.

For players investing in Escoffier’s C1 or C2, focusing on Cryo DPS characters becomes even more important. C1 massively increases Crit DMG for Cryo units, while C2 boosts Cryo DPS output based on Escoffier’s ATK. Without proper team synergy, these constellations lose value, making careful team-building decisions crucial for maximizing Escoffier’s potential.

3 Not Considering Other Element Characters for Flexibility

While it may be quite counterintuitive to the first mistake, some compositions may benefit more from including strong support units or non-Cryo/Hydro DPS characters, especially in low-investment team setups. Since Escoffier’s passive scaling is heavily dependent on Freeze synergies, players who lack the ideal Cryo and Hydro characters may struggle to fully optimize her kit, making more flexible alternatives worth considering.

In Melt teams , pairing Escoffier with Mavuika, Arlecchino, or Hu Tao can allow her Cryo application to trigger Melt reactions, offering a different way to utilize her support role. Similarly, for Neuvillette compositions , players may find it more beneficial to replace Escoffier with Kazuha or Xilonen, whose buffs compensate for the loss of Hydro/Cryo RES reduction. Thanks to high damage multipliers and superior buffing abilities, these units may provide more consistent value, making Escoffier’s niche resistance shred less of a necessity in certain setups.

2 Not Focusing On the Correct Stats

Despite being classified as a support and healer, Escoffier plays a dual role as an ATK-scaling sub-DPS, making offensive stats just as important as her utility-based abilities. Since her healing scale with ATK, focusing on ATK%, Crit DMG, and Crit Rate ensures she provides strong team-wide buffs while also dealing significant off-field damage.

Thanks to Cryo resonance, Escoffier naturally gains increased Crit Rate when paired with another Cryo character, making Crit DMG stacking much easier in comparison to focusing on Crit Rate. Given that her healing also scales with ATK, an ATK goblet may be more beneficial than Cryo DMG, ensuring higher healing output.

1 Not Understanding her Off-the-Cuff Cookery Mode

While Escoffier’s Elemental Skill is primarily used in Cold Storage Mode by tapping rather than holding, she has a unique passive ability that allows players to convert ingredients into food on a weekly basis. This functions similarly to the Parametric Transformer , as holding her Elemental Skill places a Cooking Mek on the field, which requires ingredients and elemental energy to process materials into dishes.

Although this mechanic has no direct combat value, it can be useful for players with excess ingredients or those who rarely engage in manual cooking . However, players should be aware of the weekly limit imposed on the number of dishes created, as it resets with the weekly reset cycle. For those looking to maximize efficiency, Escoffier’s passive provides a low-maintenance way to replenish food supplies, making her a unique resource-generating support character.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Genshin Impact: Ifa Constellation Guide
item.description:
Ifa

Anemo

Catalyst

Natlan ( Tlalocan)

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Ifa joins Genshin Impact as an Anemo Catalyst user from Natlan , specializing in on-field elemental driving, particularly for Swirl and Electro-Charged reactions . Unlike many specific reaction-based units, Ifa does not require niche team compositions to maximize his potential, making him a flexible choice in various setups. His kit enables continuous Swirl application, allowing him to trigger elemental reactions consistently while maintaining strong battlefield presence.

While Ifa’s base kit already offers strong reaction-based utility, his constellations further refine his effectiveness by improving energy management, healing power, reaction dmg buff, and personal damage scaling. As a 4-star character, his constellations are far more accessible , making them tempting for players looking for affordable upgrades without committing to high-cost investments. However, players should still carefully consider whether to prioritize his constellations or save their resources for upcoming characters—especially if they are not interested in the 5-star unit featured alongside him. Here’s a breakdown of how Ifa's constellations fare in Genshin Impact and whether they’re worth pursuing.

Are Ifa Constellations Worth It In Genshin Impact?

In short, no - unless aiming for the 5-star in the banner. As a 4-star character, Ifa’s constellations are far more accessible than those of 5-star units, making him a relatively low-investment option for players looking to refine his kit. F2P players may find his constellation upgrades easier to obtain, especially if they are already pulling for the 5-star character featured on his banner or don't mind obtaining his constellations overtime through the standard gacha pool. That being said, Ifa is perfectly fine at C0, and players who simply want to have him without investing further won’t miss out on his core functionality. His base kit already provides strong Swirl application , team utility, and healing, meaning constellations are more of a bonus than a necessity.

If players are considering constellation investment, C2 is generally the best stopping point, as it strengthens his passive buffs and improves team damage output for Swirl and Electro-Charged oriented teams. Higher constellations, while beneficial, require a deeper commitment that may not be worth the gacha risk if players aren’t interested in the featured 5-star unit.

Those saving for other characters may find it more practical to hold off, ensuring they don’t disrupt their pity count for future banners. Ultimately, Ifa’s constellations offer useful enhancements, but they are only truly worthwhile if players are already pulling on his banner or looking to maximize his role as an on-field elemental driver within reaction-based teams.

C1 - Vitiferous Elixir's Concoction

Effect

When Supporting Fire hits an opponent, it will restore 6 Energy for Ifa. One such Energy restoration can be triggered once every 8s.

Importance

Low

Ifa’s first constellation provides a small but useful energy regeneration utility, restoring 6 Energy every time he hits an enemy. While this effect has an 8-second cooldown, meaning it won’t drastically change his energy management, it does help ensure consistent Burst uptime. Given that Ifa’s Elemental Burst has a relatively low energy cost, this constellation allows him to activate his Burst every rotation without needing to heavily invest in Energy Recharge stats.

However, for players running double Electro teams, this constellation becomes less necessary, as Electro units and resonance typically provide battery utility . Especially in such a team composition, C1 is more of a convenience rather than a necessity, making it a situational upgrade rather than a must-have.

C2 - Guiding Spirit of Ballistic Prayer

Effect

When Ifa is in the Nightsoul's Blessing state, every Nightsoul point the party has above a total of 60 will grant Ifa 4 additional Rescue Essentials points.

Additionally, Ifa's Rescue Essentials limit is increased by 50.

Importance

Priority

Ifa’s second constellation enhances his A1 Passive, increasing the damage of Swirl and Electro-Charged reactions while he is in Nightsoul State by both providing additional points, but also by increasing the stacking amount of Rescue Essentials. From a team utility perspective, this is his strongest constellation, as it directly boosts reaction-based damage, benefiting both Ifa and his teammates. If the team primarily consists of Natlan characters who tend to have high Nightsoul points for the most part, players will see even more value from this constellation than otherwise.

For F2P or low-spending players, C2 is an excellent stopping point, as it provides significant team-wide value without requiring further investment. Those who don’t plan to pull for limited characters on his debut banner can comfortably stop at C2, ensuring they still get strong reaction buffs for the team without committing to higher constellations.

C4 - Decayed Vessel's Permutation

Effect

The restraining wind current created by the Elemental Burst Compound Sedation Field lasts for 3 extra seconds.

Additionally, Ifa gains 100 Elemental Mastery for 15s after using his Elemental Burst Compound Sedation Field .

Importance

High

Ifa’s fourth constellation improves his elemental driving capabilities, ensuring that Swirled elements remain on enemies for 3 extra seconds after using his Burst. This extension allows longer reaction windows, making it easier for team members to capitalize on Swirl or Electro-Charged interactions. Additionally, since Ifa’s Burst pulls enemies together, this constellation enhances crowd control, keeping enemies grouped for longer durations, as otherwise the Elemental Burst only pulls them for a short moment once activated.

Beyond reaction consistency, C4 also grants Ifa an additional 100 Elemental Mastery, which directly improves his Swirl damage and healing output as they both scale through his Elemental Mastery. Overall, not as impactful as his second constellation but still provides some team-wide utility.

C6 - Oath on a Feathered Knot

Effect

When Ifa uses the Hold version of his Supporting Fire , there is a 50% chance that he will fire an additional Tonicshot that deals 120% of Ifa's ATK as Anemo DMG. This DMG is considered Normal Attack DMG.

Additionally, when he is not in combat, Ifa will consume 20% less Nightsoul points and Phlogiston in his Nightsoul's Blessing state.

Importance

Medium

Ifa’s sixth constellation helps with his own DMG, granting a 50% chance to fire an extra, stronger bullet when using the Hold version of his Elemental Skill. While this effect adds extra damage, it less impactful compared to his earlier constellations which brings team wide utility.

Additionally, C6 reduces Nightsoul point consumption by 20% while exploring, allowing longer flight durations outside of combat. This makes C6 particularly useful for players who prioritize exploration , especially those who don’t have Chasca or Mavuika. Nevertheless, while C6 is a decent upgrade, it is not as important as C2 or C4, making it more of a luxury constellation rather than a core improvement.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Genshin Impact: Ifa Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Ifa

Anemo

Catalyst

Natlan

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Ifa joins Genshin Impact as an Anemo Catalyst user from Natlan, specializing in reaction-driven combat through Swirl and Electro-Charged reactions . Unlike conventional Anemo supports that focus on team-wide buffs or crowd control , Ifa thrives as an on-field elemental driver, ensuring consistent reaction triggers that enhance team damage output. His kit allows him to not only trigger reactions, but he also has healing abilities and somewhat of a short-lasting crowd control to pull enemies.

One of Ifa’s defining strengths is his Ascension passive, which boosts Swirl and Electro-Charged damage based on his Nightsoul’s Blessing state. This means, he has synergy with Electro and Hydro characters though he remains flexible enough to function outside of specific elemental restrictions. While Ifa excels in Taser compositions, he is also a strong choice for multi-element teams, where his Swirl application distributes various elements across enemies.

It's also important to note that, beyond specific elements benefiting Ifa’s team compositions, he requires at least one Natlan character in the team to maximize his buffs for Swirl and Electro-Charged damage. His buff scaling is based on the combined Nightsoul points of all characters in the party, meaning Natlan units contribute significantly to his overall effectiveness. Additionally, having another Natlan character helps activate his passive talent, which grants 80 Elemental Mastery for 12 seconds whenever a Nightsoul Burst is triggered. With more Natlan characters, the cooldown of Nightsoul Bursts is further reduced, allowing this buff to remain active almost indefinitely. While this synergy is beneficial, it is not mandatory, meaning Ifa can still function well in teams without full Natlan representation. Here's Ifa's best team compositions with all things considered in Genshin Impact .

Ororon is one of Ifa’s best partners, serving as a strong off-field Electro unit and a Natlan character, that also has benefits built in his kit for Electro-Recharged. His abilities help maintain Electro-Charged uptime, reinforcing Ifa’s role as an on-field elemental driver while optimizing reaction-based damage. That being said, essentially Ororon can be in each of his teams that require an Electro character, however it is also possible to ignore this buff.

Ifa + Ororon + Furina + Kuki Shinobu

Ororon, serves as Ifa’s best team member by providing consistent off-field AoE Electro application, and being the best candidate to wear Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City artifact set to provide buffs for the team. Alongside Ororon, Furina also pairs well with Ifa . She benefits from his ability to spread Hydro through Swirl, while contributing team-wide buffs, sub-DPS potential, and strong Hydro application. However, since Ifa’s healing alone is insufficient to sustain Furina’s HP drain, an additional healer is necessary to keep the team stable while maximizing Furina’s damage buffs.

Since Furina’s Hydro application is already strong, the team can benefit more from an Electro-oriented healer, such as Kuki Shinobu, who not only provides consistent healing but also enhances Electro-Charged uptime in close-combat scenarios. This synergy also improves Energy regeneration, helping Ifa maintain Elemental Burst rotations efficiently. Alternatively, players can opt for Hydro healers like Sigewinne, Kokomi, or even Barbara, though Sigewinne and Kokomi being limited characters make them high-investment options. Given that Ifa is a 4-star character who can thrive in low-investment teams, prioritizing mostly accessible 4-star units ensures strong synergy without overcommitting resources.

Team Roles

  • Ifa : Elemental Driver, Buffer, Healer, Crowd Control
  • Ororon: Electro Enabler, Crowd Control (Taunt), Buffer (Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City set)
  • Furina: Buffer, Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler
  • Kuki Shinobu: Healer, Electro Enabler

Ifa + Neuvillette + Fischl + Ororon

Ifa naturally complements reaction-based team compositions, making him a strong fit alongside Neuvillette, Fischl, and Ororon. This team efficiently utilizes Swirl, Electro-Charged, and Hydro application to maintain strong elemental synergy. Neuvillette serves as the primary DPS, delivering consistent Hydro damage through his charged attacks, while Fischl and Ororon provide reliable off-field Electro application, ensuring steady Electro-Charged uptime. Since both Electro supports are interchangeable, players can swap them for other Electro units based on availability, however these options remain as the most cost-effective characters for Ifa teams specifically.

Ifa plays a secondary role in this team and hence won't be played to his full potential with long on-field time, and replaces units like Kazuha, Venti or Sucrose in case players don't have access to them, especially in content like Imaginarium Theater where players may be needing to make some unconventional teams at times. As such, Ifa acts as a momentary Electro-Charged buffer while offering crowd control, ensuring Neuvillette can line up his charged attacks more effectively. Given that Neuvillette has built-in healing from his HP drain gain mechanics, Ifa’s healing is sufficient, meaning a dedicated healer is unnecessary. This composition allows for efficient reaction triggers, maintaining consistent damage output without requiring high-resource investments.

Team Roles

  • Ifa: Elemental Driver, Buffer, Healer, Crowd Control
  • Neuvillette: Main DPS, Hydro Enabler
  • Fischl: Electro Enabler, Sub-DPS, Battery
  • Ororon: Electro Enabler, Crowd Control (Taunt), Buffer (Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City set)

Ifa + Pyro Traveler + Citlali + Xilonen

Ifa, Pyro Traveler, Citlali, and Xilonen form a Rainbow DPS elemental driver team focused on Melt reactions, rather than Electro-Charged setups. Ifa plays an essential role in spreading both Pyro and Cryo elements through Swirl, ensuring consistent reaction uptime while providing crowd control and healing. While Mavuika would be the optimal Pyro DPS choice, Pyro Traveler is a low-investment alternative, allowing players to maintain Melt synergy without requiring a high-resource commitment.

Pyro Traveler provides steady off-field Pyro application, supporting Melt triggers, while Citlali enhances reaction consistency through her Pyro buffs for Melt teams and Cryo application. Xilonen offers team-wide buffs and healing, while her field up-time is very minimal. Since the team already includes both a healer and a shielder, players who do not have access to Xilonen can opt for flexible last-slot choices, such as Kazuha, Bennett, or any other preferred unit. Additionally, because this composition consists entirely of Natlan characters, players won’t need to worry about optimizing Ifa’s Rescue Essentials stacks.

Team Roles:

  • Ifa: Elemental Driver, Buffer, Crowd Control, Healer
  • Pyro Traveler: Pyro Enabler, Sub-DPS
  • Citlali: Buffer, Shielder, Cryo Enabler
  • Xilonen: Buffer, Healer

Ifa + Yae Miko + Nahida + Xingqiu

Ifa, Yae Miko, Nahida, and Xingqiu form a highly flexible reaction-based team, utilizing Electro-Charged, Aggravate, Swirl, and Hyperbloom to maximize elemental damage. Ifa serves as the elemental driver, spreading Hydro and Electro via Swirl while providing healing and crowd control. Yae Miko functions as the Electro sub-DPS, delivering high off-field damage through her turrets, while Nahida ensures consistent Dendro application and boosts Elemental Mastery for increased reaction damage. This EM bonus enhances both Nahida’s own damage output and Ifa’s Swirl damage and healing potential. It is worth noting that since there are no other Natlan characters in this team composition unless Yae Miko is swapped with Ororon, players won't be noticing a significant buff to Swirl or Electro-Charged.

Xingqiu supports the team with Hydro application via coordinated attacks while offering defensive utility. His damage reduction and interruption resistance are particularly beneficial for mitigating the self-inflicted damage from Hyperbloom reactions, complementing Ifa’s healing. While Yelan can substitute Xingqiu in this setup, she lacks his defensive capabilities and is a more resource-intensive five-star unit. Similarly, Yae Miko can be swapped for other characters including Ororon, Fischl or Raiden Shogun, depending on players' roster. Given that all three sub-DPS characters function effectively off-field, Ifa can remain on-field for extended periods without requiring frequent swaps, allowing him to consistently trigger elemental reactions and maintain team synergy.

Team Roles:

  • Ifa: Elemental Driver, Buffer, Crowd Control, Healer
  • Yae Miko: Sub-DPS, Electro Enabler
  • Nahida: Sub-DPS, Dendro Enabler, Buffer
  • Xingqiu: Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Damage Reduction

item.title: 7 Most Iconic Protagonists In FPS Games
item.description:
Summary

  • FPS icons like Soap, Lilith, and Doom Slayer stand out for their deeper, human-like personalities.
  • Characters like Sam Stone and Master Chief become iconic for their over-the-top, legendary personas.
  • Gordon Freeman's silent presence and Master Chief's restrained strength add layers to their enduring appeal.

Some characters become iconic because of their voice, others because of their silence. In first-person shooters, where players are often strapped into the boots of relentless warriors, over-the-top heroes, or reluctant legends, a select few protagonists manage to transcend the confines of their genre. These are the faces (or helmets) people remember long after the bullets stop flying.

Whether it's through a rich backstory, a recognizable silhouette, or just an absolutely absurd body count, the following FPS icons have carved their names into gaming history. Some talk too much, some never speak, and one of them will chainsaw an alien with a grin on his face. But all of them belong on this list.

7 John "Soap" MacTavish

"What Kind Of Name Is Soap" - Captain Price

Your comment has not been saved

Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare (2007)
9.4 /10
Released
November 5, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Infinity Ward
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360, Nintendo DS
Powered by

Soap didn’t start Modern Warfare as the guy everyone knew — that spot was reserved for Captain Price and his legendary mustache. But over the course of the series, John MacTavish rose through the ranks from the wide-eyed FNG to the emotionally grounded heart of Task Force 141. It’s easy to forget just how rare it was at the time to have a Call of Duty protagonist with a consistent arc across multiple titles, and Soap’s journey — from executing raids in Pripyat to laying down his life in Modern Warfare 3 — was a massive part of the franchise’s narrative evolution.

What made Soap iconic wasn’t just his slick mohawk or his signature Scottish brogue, it was the way he balanced military grit with actual personality. He joked with Ghost, clashed with authority, and most importantly, felt human in a franchise often obsessed with spectacle. Even in the rebooted Modern Warfare II (2022), Soap's return was met with widespread excitement. The writing leaned into his chemistry with Ghost, and the internet responded with memes, fan art, and full-blown TikTok edits. Not bad for someone who started the campaign as “the new guy.”

6 Samuel Herbert Stone

Make Room For Mayhem

Your comment has not been saved

Serious Sam: The First Encounter
Released
March 21, 2001

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Sam Stone doesn’t do subtle. He doesn’t whisper, he doesn’t sneak, and he definitely doesn’t worry about ammo conservation. The face of the Serious Sam series is basically Duke Nukem if Duke never took a coffee break. Originally introduced in 2001 as a time-traveling, one-liner-spouting action hero sent to stop the alien overlord Mental, Sam’s whole deal is volume — both in terms of explosions and personality.

And it works. The Serious Sam franchise, with its ludicrous enemy waves, oversized weaponry, and deliberately chaotic pacing, only functions because Sam is at the center of it all, shrugging off kamikaze screams and casually headshotting headless bombers. He’s self-aware, ridiculous, and very much in on the joke. Whether it’s fighting through ancient Egypt or punching Lovecraftian horrors in the face, Sam brings the same unbothered confidence and absurd commentary. Over the years, his character hasn't really evolved, but that’s the point. He’s gaming’s comfort food — loud, dumb, and absurdly satisfying.

5 Lilith

One of the Six Sirens

Your comment has not been saved

Borderlands
8.0 /10
Released
October 20, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Gearbox Software
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Lilith wasn’t just a siren by title — she was a symbol of power, defiance, and neon-soaked carnage. First introduced as one of the original Vault Hunters in Borderlands , she stood out from the start thanks to her mysterious Phasewalk ability and backstory as one of the six sirens in the universe. But it was in Borderlands 2 and 3 where her legacy really took shape, transforming her from a playable character to the driving force of the Crimson Raiders and, eventually, the literal spark that saved the planet.

Unlike many FPS protagonists, Lilith is layered. She carries trauma, makes mistakes, and pushes forward anyway. She was deeply affected by Roland’s death, took up his mantle, and made hard choices that left lasting consequences on Pandora and beyond. Her Phase abilities evolved into wings of fire, turning her into a living weapon against tyrants like Handsome Jack and the Calypso Twins. When she sacrifices herself at the end of Borderlands 3 , her phoenix-shaped flame branding the sky, it feels earned — a rare moment of gravitas in a series better known for fart jokes and loot showers.

4 B.J. Blazkowicz

Nazi-Killer By Day, War Machine By Every Other Hour

3 Images
3 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Wolfenstein 3D
FPS
Systems
Released
May 5, 1992

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
id Software
Platform(s)
3DO, Atari Jaguar, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PC, PS3, SNES, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Mobile
Powered by

Decades before most modern FPS heroes were even ideas, there was William Joseph Blazkowicz. From his early days pixelating Nazis in Wolfenstein 3D to the heart-wrenching, politically charged monologues in Wolfenstein: The New Order and The New Colossus , B.J. has always been gaming’s original war-drenched icon. But he’s not the same musclebound caricature he once was.

The rebooted Wolfenstein games gave B.J. a soul. Players got to know the man behind the shotgun — a Southern soldier torn between duty and despair, haunted by childhood abuse and the ever-growing weight of his mission. His internal narration, often delivered in a quiet, broken voice between levels, turned him into one of the most compelling characters in the genre. Even when he’s dual-wielding automatic shotguns and mowing through hordes of mechs in alternate-history America, there’s always something deeper simmering underneath. Blazkowicz isn't just a Nazi-killer. He’s a survivor, a father, and a man trying to make sure the world doesn't burn before his children get a chance to live in it.

3 Doom Slayer

Rip And Tear Has A Face

3 Images
3 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Doom (1993)
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 1993

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
9.0 /10

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
id Software
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Stadia, PS3, Xbox 360, Xbox (Original), PS1, Sega Saturn, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Android, iOS
Powered by

There’s no mistaking that helmet. No mistaking the rage either. The Doom Slayer doesn’t speak, but his message is loud and clear: if it moves, it dies. While Doomguy was once a faceless marine shooting demons in a Martian facility, the rebooted Slayer in DOOM (2016) and DOOM Eternal elevated the character to near-mythical status. He’s not just a guy with a shotgun anymore — he’s a walking apocalypse feared even by the forces of Hell.

Lore-wise, the Slayer is hilariously overqualified for every situation. He’s canonically so dangerous that demons lock themselves in vaults just to avoid him. His origin stretches across dimensions, and at one point he joins a race of alien warriors who literally give him the title "Doom Slayer" because “Doomguy” just didn’t cut it anymore. Every part of his gameplay reinforces his legend — from ripping out Cacodemon eyes to performing balletic shotgun-led dismemberment routines, the Slayer is aggression and death incarnate. And the music? Just as brutal. Mick Gordon’s heavy metal soundtrack practically syncs with his heartbeat.

2 Gordon Freeman

The Most Famous Silent Treatment In Gaming

Your comment has not been saved

Half-Life
12
9.5 /10
Released
November 19, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Developer(s)
Valve
Platform(s)
PC, PS2, Linux, macOS
Powered by

Gordon Freeman may never say a word, but his presence speaks volumes. The theoretical physicist from MIT who became the poster boy for alien annihilation is one of the most enduring icons in gaming — not just because of what he’s done, but because of how Half-Life told his story. Valve made the brilliant choice to never break first-person immersion, meaning Gordon never once leaves the player's perspective, making his silence strangely powerful.

Armed with nothing but a crowbar and a Ph.D., Freeman battles his way through the Black Mesa disaster, surviving headcrab infestations, military clean-up squads, and interdimensional horror shows. But what makes him so special is how the world reacts to him. Scientists idolize him, rebels rally behind him, and enemies speak his name with dread. In Half-Life 2 , Alyx Vance treats him like a legend returned from the dead — a status that somehow feels earned despite him never uttering a single line. Freeman isn’t just a protagonist. He’s a lens through which players experience one of the most influential sagas in FPS history.

1 Master Chief

The Green Armor That Launched A Franchise

Your comment has not been saved

Halo: Combat Evolved
9.3 /10
Released
November 15, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Bungie, Gearbox Software
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox (Original), Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

There are few silhouettes in gaming more iconic than that seven-foot Spartan in Mjolnir armor. Master Chief — or John-117, for the lore lovers — has been the face of Halo since 2001, and in many ways, the face of Xbox itself. But despite being a genetically enhanced super-soldier trained from childhood to kill, what makes Chief iconic isn't just his strength — it's his restraint.

He’s calm under fire, loyal to a fault, and endlessly driven by duty, even when the orders get murky. His relationship with Cortana added emotional depth to an otherwise stoic character, turning a monosyllabic soldier into someone fans genuinely worried about. That’s no small feat, especially when your face is never even shown.

Over the years, Master Chief has saved humanity from the Covenant, the Flood, rogue AI, and, more recently, a disgruntled alien cult that thinks he’s some kind of demon. In every battle, whether on a crumbling Halo ring or inside a Forerunner megastructure, he’s the calm in the storm. Players don’t just play as Master Chief. They become him — a walking tank with a heart buried deep beneath layers of green steel and alien shrapnel.
